intro: Flueckigera macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered flueckigera, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
